Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • Storage

  • public class Storage
extends java.lang.Object
    The Storage class can be used to store and process geographical image data. The Storage class stores and geographical image data and is called upon by methods in other classes to process this data so that it can be displayed as an image.
    Version:
    1.0 09 Jan 2012
    Author:
    Nicholas Addis

    • Method Detail

      • setData

        void setData(double[][] dataIn)
        This is the setData method which sets the data for the array. The data array is a 300 by 300 array of type double of landscape or other geographical data.
        Parameters:
        variables - (double [][] dataIn)

      • getData

        This is the getData method which returns the data for the current 2D Array.

        Returns:
        data for 2D Array.

      • getDataAsImage

        public java.awt.Image getDataAsImage()
        The 'getDataAsImage' method gets the data from the array and displays this as an image. The data is put into a 1D array re-ranged between 0 and 255.
        Parameters:
        void - no input parameters.
        Returns:
        image.

      • modellingDrunks

        void modellingDrunks(double[][] data)
        This is the modellingDrunks method, which models the journeys taken by 25 'drunk people' from a public house to their respective homes. The method models the journeys taken by the 'drunk individuals', who move randomly left, right up or down, until they reach their house. A density map of the number of individuals who pass through each point on the map is taken and then displayed as a density map.
        Parameters:
        variables - (double[][] data)

      • getDataAsImageDrunks

        public java.awt.Image getDataAsImageDrunks()
        The 'getDataAsImageDrunks' method gets the data from the array and displays this as an image. The data is put into a 1D array re-ranged between 0 and 255.
        Parameters:
        void - no input parameters.
        Returns:
        image.

      • rerangeArray

        double[][] rerangeArray(double newMaximum,
                      double newMinimum)
        This is the rerangeArray method which reranges the current data array. The array holds geographical data.
        Parameters:
        (double - newMaximum, double newMinimum).
        Returns:
        tempArray.
